article.description: DeAndre Davis had 15 points and six rebounds to lead Alcorn State to its first win of the season, a 68-60 victory over NAIA Blue Mountain College on Monday night.
article.headline: Alcorn State tops Blue Mountain College, 68-60
article.linkText: Alcorn State tops Blue Mountain College, 68-60
article.story: LORMAN, Miss. -- DeAndre Davis had 15 points and six rebounds to lead Alcorn State to its first win of the season, a 68-60 victory over NAIA Blue Mountain College on Monday night. Davis finished a perfect 7-for-7 shooting from the field. Patrick Onwenu had 11 points and Devonte Hampton added 10 for Alcorn State (1-7), which shot 53.3 percent from the field and got to the free throw line 29 times. Alcorn State opened the game on a 31-13 scoring stretch, but led just 37-31 at the break. A pair of free throws by Tyrel Hunt pushed the Braves' lead back to double digits, 50-40, with 12:18 remaining. Another Hunt free throw with 2:50 left extended the Alcorn State advantage to 64-49, the highest mark of the half. Deaundre Smith led the Toppers with 17 points. Vladimir Filipovic had 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
